Dear Janowski,                    Hoping I can arrange a fixture for some grain to Salalah. I’ve got 4,200MT from Manzanillo to Salalah, do you have something to fill that up and send back empty? That would be awesome.                    Thanks,                    Mike
Email 2:
This came by email and I emailed the sender right back. 

Please see my reply to you below: 

“Nice to hear from you and I have a few things to clear up so I can post this on your thread. 

First I want to state that this is not my machine but an attached mobile crane. I will try to email you pics. It is definitely a 40′ truck cranes 2WD, it has a liquid pressure test kit in the front and a “Smokin Box” on the side with winch. It is fully self contained with 40,000 gallons of diesel. 

If you want you can see pictures at this website: http://www.bradcoengineering.com 

This is an Arizana 18m Truck Crane 2WD with Swivel winch in front that holds up to 1000kg (2200lbs). It

            Email 1:
Mr. Best,                    Hope your day is going well.                    I've just finished doing a brief research on your website and found your services extremely interesting.                    I would like to know if you offer services in loading and unloading my load of biomass from Hamburg to Yokohama.                    Additionally, if possible, I would like to know if your rates are cheaper than the rates offered by any of your competitors.                    Finally, if possible, could you confirm that your rates will be affected by the change in the currency rates.                    Thank you very much.                    Natalie
Email 2:
Mr. Best,                    It has been two days since you wrote to me. My response was trapped in your spam inbox and somehow got delivered to my friends' email.                    I've just gone through your website, the services offered and it's very interesting.                    The charges of transporting a container from Hamburg to Yokohama have increased over the past two months, so I'm afraid my load cannot be transported for the same amount of money I paid for.                    I would like to know if you would offer me a discounted price and confirm this by email. I would also be glad to pay you for all the expenses incurred due to my delay in replying.                    Thanks again and have a great day.                    Natalie

<Email 3>:
Mr. Best,                    Hope you're doing well.                    I've just gone through your website and was thoroughly impressed with your service.                    I
Email 3:
Mr. Best,                    Hope you're doing well.                    I've just gone through your website and was thoroughly impressed with your service.                    I

Mr. Best,                    Hi! I know it has been 5 days since you emailed me. As you know I was trapped in a function meeting and could not reply.                    I'm currently trying to come up with a load of 20 foot container to be transported from Hamburg to Yokohama. Would it be possible to have a look at my details and get back to me with the estimates of transportation services. I would be happy to provide you with the necessary details regarding the cargo to be transported.                    Thanks for your prompt response.                    Natalie

<Email 5>:
Mr. Best,                    Hi,                I hope all's well.                Just wanted to let you know that I have sent you a text.                I look forward to hearing from you.                Thanks.                Natalie

Hey Mr. Rajesh,                    Shipping 15k MT of wood pulp from Shenzhen to Shanghai. Assuming constant speed, could you please provide a laycan for this charter?                    Thanks,                    Hans
Email 2:
Hey Mr. Rajesh,
Are you interested in bringing a third party into this deal as you've been asking for price on S&P and a new producer? If not I can work with the other two and try to push them along as there is a minimum of a two week lead time for chartering.
Thanks
Hans
Email 3:
Hey Hans,

Okay for S&P chartering I have sent back the P/L.

For Shenzhen to Shanghai I have sent you a laycan. I would highly appreciate the laycan from your side as well to provide a target day for this charter. As it was discussed in the meeting that we will not give this laycan without a confirmation from your side. But also I am not willing to start my contract until I have at least one confirmed lead. Thus I would be really grateful if you could provide me with the laycan as soon as possible.

Thanks & Best
T.N.

<Email 4>:
Hello Mr. Nagawaramma,
As per your request, I can provide the laycan for Shenzhen to Shanghai. Our shipment date is 24.09.2021, arrival date 28.09.2021.
Hans
Best regards
<Email

##  How to send email with Klaviyo:

### Insert the email code

1. Log in to Klaviyo.
2. Click **Emails**.
3. Select **Settings** and click **Email Codes**.
4. Click **Insert**.

### Test the email

1. Open an email template in the **Design** section.
2. Click **Email Code** to see the list of email codes.
3. Double-click the code and the code becomes a placeholder.

### Set up
Email 4:
We are looking to sell 100,000 MT of gasoline for export. Can you give me your latest prices and laycan dates for July-September?

4. In the **Message** section, fill in the details to set up the message.
5. In the **Build** section, check the email as you want.
6. Click **Save** to save.

### Send the email

1. Click **Draft** or **Active**.
2. In the **Subject** section, enter a subject.
3. Click **Send** to send the email.

### Review

1. The sent message will appear in the **Sent** tab.
2. To view the message history, click the dropdown next to the **Send** button.

### Troubleshooting

#### The email doesn’t work

When the email does not work, the following solutions will help you:

1. Check
